snippet: Mr. St. John-Stevas, later Lord St. John of Fawsley, was among the left-leaning Tories culled by Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher in the early 1980s.
abstract: Norman St John-Stevas, British Conservative politician who had been dismissed by Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher when she culled left-leaning Tories from her cabinet in the early 1980s, dies at age 82.
lead_paragraph: Mr. St. John-Stevas, later Lord St. John of Fawsley, was among the left-leaning Tories culled by Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher in the early 1980s.

headline.seo: Norman St. John-Stevas, Tory Dismissed by Thatcher, Dies at 82
headline.main: Norman St. John-Stevas, Dapper Tory Dismissed by Thatcher, Dies at 82
